Remarks.
Platyscelis ballioni
( Fig. 47 ) was published by Reitter (1889) with a single female specimen from Shanxi , China . Kaszab (1940) examined and redescribed the specimen in his revision of the tribe Platyscelidini worldwide, and diagnosed it from
Blaps rugifrons Germar
with the characters: elytra quite flat and parallel (arched and short oval in
B. rugifrons
); apex of protibiae strongly foliate extended (not strongly in
B. rugifrons
).
P. brevis
( Figs. 48–49 ) distributed in Mongolian Plateau, 291 specimens were examined in this study, body short in north and longer in south generally. Therefore,
P. ballioni
was a female of
P. brevis
in southern Mongolian Plateau.
